conclusion: Trace the paths of the liquids flowing from points A, B, and C through the baffles.
Liquid from A (pink) and B (green) flow towards the slope of the yellow baffle.
Liquids from A and B combine and continue flowing down towards the blue baffle.
Liquid from C (blue) flows directly down.
Liquid from C merges with the pink and green liquids from A and B.
The combined stream flows down past the orange baffle.
The mixture heads towards the rightmost area of the containers.
The flow is directed into container G due to the slope and position of the final baffle.
Based on the analysis, the liquid flows into container G.
